DistanceMetricExtensions

Functions
CalculateCentroid
public static ConnectionGenes<T> CalculateCentroid<T>(
this IDistanceMetric<T> distanceMetric,
List<ConnectionGenes<T>> points
)
where T : struct

Calculates the centroid for the given set of points.

The centroid is a central position within a set of points that minimizes the sum of the squared distance between each of those points and the centroid. As such it can also be thought of as being representative of the set of points.  The centroid calculation is dependent on the distance metric, hence this method is defined on IDistanceMetric{T}. For some distance metrics the centroid may not be a unique point, in those cases one of the possible centroids is returned.  A centroid is used in k-means clustering to define the centre of a cluster.

Type Parameter
T

Coordinate component data type.

Parameters
distanceMetric
this IDistanceMetric<T>

The distance metric instance.

points
List<ConnectionGenes<T>>

The set of points.

Returns

A new instance of ConnectionGenes{T}.

FindMedoid
public static int FindMedoid(
this IDistanceMetric<double> distanceMetric,
ReadOnlySpan<ConnectionGenes<double>> points
)

Find medoid by comparing each coordinate with every other coordinate.

The coord with the lowest average distance from all other coords is the most central coord (the medoid).  This method uses an inefficient N*N comparison of coords to find a medoid. It is provided only as a last resort for distance metrics for which no means exist to calculate a centroid.

Parameters
distanceMetric
this IDistanceMetric<double>

Distance metric.

points
ReadOnlySpan<ConnectionGenes<double>>

The set of points.

Returns

The index of the element in points that is the medoid.
